page.title: 07Crathie Parish Church
page.content: Crathie church was built in when Queen Victoria was at Balmoral.I go to Sunday school at Crathie church. I sit opposite the Queen. There are glass windows with coloured pictures on them. There is a special door that the Royal Family uses. The organist and the choir sit above the main door. There are plaques that show which soldiers were up with the Queen. Mr Angus is the minister and when he is absent Mr Gardiner takes over. The church officer looks after the pulpit for Mr Angus. When the Queen comes up there are a lot of tourists to see her.The police put up barriers so there are no accidents. Some tourists go in to church hoping to see the Queen. When the Royal Family is not here a cover is put over their seats.
